headline: Disney to raise $4 billion, first high-grade deal since 2020
summary: Disney is likely to use the cash mainly to repay debt and aid “liquidity for increased shareholder returns and strategic investments,” according to Bloomberg Intelligence.  The company has $2.6 billion of bonds and loans due the rest of this year, data compiled by Bloomberg shows.  Disney announced last week that the head of its theme parks, cruise ships and consumer-products division will replace Bob Iger as chief executive officer next month.
